articles.author: Natalie Rahhal
articles.title: Tens of millions of older Americans are taking low-dose aspirin, survey finds. For many, the medication's risks may outweigh the benefits. - Yahoo Life
articles.description: U.S. health officials changed recommendations two years ago, advising most people 60 and over not to take preventive aspirin — but 30% still do, the survey...
articles.content: Many older adults are unknowingly putting themselves at risk for internal bleeding by taking low-dose aspirin preventively, a new survey finds, even though it is no longer recommended by health offic… [+5034 chars]
